description:
Sweet, short canyon for those looking to get one in in an afternoon.

Approach

Park at the wolf creek falls preserve designated parking. Grab your gear and head west. In .2 mi you'll see two pink ribbons indicating a trail, cross the road and head I'm.

Follow the path across the bridge, then go left at the top of the hill. This path will take you roughly along the water course. Go past the park bench to the Northeast, keep heading down till you see railroad tracks. Head towards the tracks. Head east till you cross over the water, then you can drop in.

Descent

R1:25' from a tree DCR

R2:50' from a downed tree in the water course

R350' two stage rappel from a tree DCR

R410',I ghosted this one till I can find a better anchor location.

Exit

Exit by heading out the fork of this canyon. Cross the fork and head up where you can see fit. Have fun.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background
name: Wolf creek falls
